text: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 782"* 10:00 am - Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy announces that Ukraine has received a new shipment of military aid from the United States, including artillery and armored vehicles.* 11:00 am - Russia's Defense Ministry claims that its forces have captured several villages in eastern Ukraine, including the town of Popasna.* 12:00 pm - The Ukrainian military releases footage showing the destruction of a Russian armored column near the city of Kharkiv.* 1:00 pm - The United Nations Security Council holds an emergency meeting to discuss the escalating violence in Ukraine, with the US and European countries calling for increased sanctions against Russia.* 2:00 pm - Pro-Russian separatist leaders in eastern Ukraine declare a new offensive against Ukrainian government forces, saying they will "liberate" the city of Donetsk.* 3:00 pm - The International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC) warns of a growing humanitarian crisis in eastern Ukraine, with thousands of civilians trapped in the conflict zone and many more forced to flee their homes.* 4:00 pm - Russia's President Vladimir Putin gives a speech, accusing the US and its allies of "fanning the flames of war" in Ukraine and vowing to continue supporting separatist forces.* 5:00 pm - The Ukrainian military launches a counterattack against Russian-backed separatists near the city of Mariupol, with reports of heavy fighting and casualties on both sides.* 6:00 pm - The US State Department announces that it will impose new sanctions on Russia in response to its continued aggression in Ukraine, targeting several Russian officials and businesses.* 7:00 pm - The European Union also imposes new sanctions on Russia, including restrictions on trade and travel for certain individuals and entities.* 8:00 pm - The Ukrainian President Zelenskyy gives a televised address, calling on the international community to do more to support Ukraine and urging Russians to speak out against their government's actions in Ukraine.* 9:00 pm - The Russian military launches a large-scale bombardment of Ukrainian positions near the city of Luhansk, with reports of significant damage and casualties.* 10:00 pm - The United Nations Secretary-General Antonio Guterres issues a statement, expressing deep concern over the escalating violence in Ukraine and calling for an immediate ceasefire and negotiations.
